comment.body: One of my best game memory in childhood :D

Welcome to ZeroNet! The rhythm is a bit slow here, but still you can find many interesting things. Besides the default sites you are visiting, you can discover some interesting stuff on [ZeroWiki](/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/) and from search engine [Kaffiene](/kaffiene.bit/). Also check the official [Help & FAQ thread](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj) if you have any question. Hope you have a good time here :)

My pleasure :D Also the theme on userstyles.org has been unmaintained for some time, check [this post on ZeroTalk](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/A+ZeroNet+Dark+Theme) for the sources of new version. `ZeroSites` is included ;)
@Grimsdottir: The link for git.gnu.io doesn't link to the updated version, try [this one](https://git.gnu.io/chbinnc/Userscripts/raw/master/Userstyles/zeronet-dark-theme.userstyle.css). Thx :)

@Grimsdottir: It sounds like you are using ZeroNet on a different server instead of 127.0.0.1. In the bottom of the css there are quite some addresses for special sites, so you need to replace all of them.
@Grimsdottir: Hey, I replace those domains in the bottom with regular expression. Could you just try again and tell me if it works? :)
Here is a ZeroWiki of [un index pour répertorier les torrents français](/122nvvhftBeZq9a47WAdg9RpkzLeWTJuw5/)
There is no diff and file change log, only the newest files signed by owner are served and updated. But you can git one by yourself.
@Martinv: Yes. Except in some cases like asking your friend whose zeronet is still offline for it. From my experience the new file can spread very fast.
@Martinv: As there is no git log, they can't get the old versions of their files. I don't know what non-official way will be.

I have this in the console: `GET 
http://192.168.1.110:43110/images/logo0.jpg     [HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found 21ms]` Do you have the file in the folder? Also svg files are not allowed to display to avoid wrapper escape [[ref]](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=svg&type=)
> Download directly accessed Pdf/Svg/Swf files instead of displaying them to avoid wrapper escape using in JS in SVG file. [Reported by Beardog108]
@Tdd: >I can click links and image shows up. Me too. If that is the problem, change `` to `` works for me.

@Tdd: Also here is the reason I found from [imachug (GitCenter)'s tutorial](https://github.com/krixano/ZeroNet-Dev-Center/issues/28)
> Because of zite address: `http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CyNApZ4zp7k3SSXsrW54vEFMHHBpDy3nm/`. So `/css/index.css` gets calculated as `http://127.0.0.1:43110/css/index.css`. So, using absolute paths is not allowed in ZeroNet.

Nice post! Btw, you need to add `\` before your link or it becomes a sub-link of ZeroMe [@TomasCW](?Profile/1White24UrrwQrD86o6Vrc1apgZ1x1o51/1A6rok3j9w6paahtGoxrePy7SSkMz5A48s/zc456@zeroid.bit "mention:1A6rok3j9w6paahtGoxrePy7SSkMz5A48s")
